I've had succes with running large (>4,6 gb) DVD files through dvdshrink. This compresses the file to norman 4,6 gb discs. Sure the picture will suffer a tiny bit, but imho its virtually unnoticable.

yeah this is 1080i (540p)

But still, better than dvd (which is 480i/p, depending on if you have a progressive scan TV and player)
Damn. Very nice rip. Better than dvd quality from what I can tell.

Time to correct some misinformation:

Though the vertical resolution is "only" 532 pixels, this is considered 720p, because there are enough pixels to fill a native 720p screen  horizontally. Increasing vertical resolution would only mess up the aspect ratio.

1080i means two sets of 540p fields (odd lines and even lines) per frame. PAL 1080i is 50 fields per second, while PAL 1080p is 25 FPS. Interlacing was originally intended to reduce flicker on the now-obsolete Cathode Ray Tube displays.

By the way, nice upload! Good to finally see a release that subtitles are part of :)
